title: Ashamed, embarrassed, hurt: Tottenham reaction to 7-2 defeat by Bayern Munich – video
text: Tottenham Hotspur suffered their heaviest home defeat in Europe as Serge Gnabry struck four goals for Bayern Munich in a 7-2 romp to seize control of Champions League Group B on Tuesday. ’I feel extremely hurt. Ashamed’, said a crestfallen Jan Vertonghen after Tottenham’s huge loss. ‘I feel very, very, very disappointed’, manager Mauricio Pochettino lamented, echoing Lucas Moura’s sentiment: ‘The feeling was really, really bad’. It was quite the opposite in the Bayern Munich camp: 'It looks like London loves me,' head coach Niko Kovac said. 'It was a great evening for Bayern Munich and for German football. To deliver a game like that is unique.'
description: Tottenham Hotspur suffered their heaviest home defeat in Europe as Serge Gnabry struck four goals for Bayern Munich in a 7-2 romp
